articles.title: Banquet Given by Central Committee and Central Military Commission of WPK
articles.content:
Banquet Given by Central Committee and Central Military Commission of WPK

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee and Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea arranged a banquet to celebrate the 66th anniversary of the glorious Workers' Party of Korea, organizer and guide of all victories of the Korean people.
					
					 Present there on invitation was Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the WPK.
					
					 Present there were senior officials of the party, state and military organs, including Kim Jong Un, Choe Yong Rim, Ri Yong Ho, Kim Yong Chun, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Kim Kyong Hui, Kang Sok Ju, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Jong Gak, Kim Yang Gon, Kim Yong Il, Pak To Chun, Choe Ryong Hae, Mun Kyong Dok, U Tong Chuk, Kim Chang Sop and other staff members of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee.
					
					 Members of the WPK Central Committee, members of the Party Central Military Commission and officials of the National Defence Commission, military organs, literary and art and media institutions were also on hand.
					
					 Kim Jong Il warmly acknowledged enthusiastic cheers of the participants and heartily congratulated them who have devoted themselves to the effort for the development of the WPK and the prosperity of the country.
					
					 Ri Yong Ho made a congratulatory speech at the banquet.

articles.title: Talks between DPRK and Lao Delegations Held
articles.content:
Talks between DPRK and Lao Delegations Held

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- Talks were held between the delegations of the DPRK Information Committee and the Ministry of Information, Culture and Tourism of Laos here on Wednesday.
					
					 Present there from the DPRK side were members of the delegation of the DPRK Information Committee led by Minister of Culture An Tong Chun, chairman of the committee, and from the opposite side members of the delegation of the Ministry of Information, Culture and Tourism of Laos led by its Minister Bosengkham Vongdara and Lao Ambassador to the DPRK Chaleune Warinthrasak.
					
					 At the talks both sides discussed the issue of boosting the relations of exchange and cooperation between the two countries in the information and cultural fields.

articles.title: Lao Delegation Arrives
articles.content:
Lao Delegation Arrives

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Lao Information, Culture and Tourism led by its Minister Bosengkham Vongdara arrived here on Wednesday.
					
					 The DPRK Information Committee gave a reception in honor of the delegation on the same day.

articles.title: Russian Ambassador to DPRK Gives Reception
articles.content:
Russian Ambassador to DPRK Gives Reception

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Valery E. Sukhinin gave a reception on Wednesday at his embassy on the 63rd anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and the Russian Federation.
					
					 Present there on invitation were Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun, Vice-Minister of Foreign Trade O Ryong Chol, Vice-Chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries So Ho Won who doubles as chairman of the DPRK-Russia Friendship Association and officials concerned.
					
					 Staff members of the Russian embassy attended.
					
					 Valery E. Sukhinin said in a speech at the reception that Russia remains unchanged in its principled stand to develop friendly relations with the DPRK.
					
					 The meeting between the top leaders of the two countries in August showed that the Russian leadership has firmly maintained its policy of deepening the Russia-DPRK good-neighborly relations, he noted, adding:
					
					 We are sincerely grateful for deep attention paid by general secretary Kim Jong Il to the development of cooperation with Russia.
					
					 Pak Ui Chun said for over six decades the two countries have steadily developed cooperation and exchange in various fields as friendly neighbors. 
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il's historic visit to Russia served as an important milestone in further developing the DPRK-Russia friendly relations in line with the desire and wishes of the peoples of the two countries and turning Northeast Asia into the region of peace and cooperation, he noted.
					
					 He will make efforts to boost the DPRK-Russian friendly and cooperative relations in the spirit agreed upon at the meeting and talks by the top leaders of the two countries.

articles.title: Palestinian Ambassador to DPRK Gives Reception
articles.content:
Palestinian Ambassador to DPRK Gives Reception
						

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- Palestinian Ambassador to the DPRK Ismail Ahmed Mohamed Hasan gave a reception at his embassy on Wednesday to celebrate the anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il's election as general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and the 66th birthday of the WPK.
					
					 Present there on invitation were Kim Yong Jin, chairman of the Education Commission, Hyon Sang Ju, chairman of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea, Pak Kun Gwang, vice department director of the Central Committee of the WPK, Pak Kil Yon, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and officials concerned.
					
					 A staff member of the Palestinian embassy here was on hand.
					
					 Speeches were made at the reception.

articles.title: Anniversary of Establishment of Diplomatic Ties between DPRK and Poland Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of Establishment of Diplomatic Ties between DPRK and Poland Marked

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- A film show was held at the People's Palace of Culture on Wednesday on the 63rd anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and Poland.
					
					 Present there were Ryu Sung Rim, vice-chairman of the DPRK-Poland Friendship Association, officials concerned, working people in the city and Polish Ambassador to the DPRK Edward Pietrzyk and his embassy officials.
					
					 The participants watched a Polish-Soviet feature film.

articles.title: A delegation of Changdok School leaves
articles.content:
A delegation of Changdok School leaves

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- A delegation of Changdok School led by its Vice-Principal Hwang Mi Suk left here Wednesday to participate in an event to be held in China on the first anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il's visit to Jilin Yuwen Middle School.
					
					 The Chinese group of tourists led by Li Zhongwen, standing vice-secretary of the Tumen City Committee of the Communist Party of China, went back home after wrapping up its tour of Mt. Chilbo on the same day.

articles.title: Global Handwashing Day Observed in DPRK
articles.content:
Global Handwashing Day Observed in DPRK 

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- A seminar took place at the Grand People's Study House in Pyongyang Wednesday with the approach of Global Handwashing Day 2011 (October 15.)
					
					 It was attended by officials of the Education Commission, the Ministry of Urban Management and other institutions concerned, and staff members of the UNICEF Pyongyang Bureau. 
					
					 Song Yong Su, a department director of the ministry, and Bijaya Rajbhandari, representative of UNICEF, made speeches at the seminar.  
					
					 Lectures were given under the titles "Global Handwashing Day and on Handwashing Activities Conducted in Various Regions of the World" and "On Situation of Handwashing Education in General Educational Institutions of the DPRK and Its Prospect." Then some teachers and schoolchildren introduced their experience.  
					
					 The day has been observed in the country since 2008 in the way of providing people, particularly children, with a good understanding of handwashing with soap and encouraging them to make it a rule to do so.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary on Sexual Assaults by GIs
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary on Sexual Assaults by GIs 

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- It was recently disclosed that soldiers of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces in south Korea committed brutal sexual assaults against teenage schoolgirls in Tongduchon of Kyonggi Province and Mapho District of Seoul. 
					
					 GIs have committed countless violence in south Korea. 
					
					 But the sexual assaults perpetrated by GIs against an old woman and teenage school girls make all the fellow countrymen shudder. 
					
					 Even south Korean media deplored the sexual assaults were too cruel to open them to press, adding: What do the ceaseless grave sexual assaults occurring in south Korea tell?
					
					 In this regard, the U.S. hastily expressed "apology and regrets" unusually. It made an excuse that the criminal was overdrunken. 
					
					 Did the ceaseless sexual assaults occur by "mistakes"? 
					
					 The incidents were not accidental ones committed by individual lechers. They are an inevitable outcome of the U.S. military presence and colonial rule over south Korea. 
					
					 The history of the U.S. forces' presence in south Korea is a bloodstained history of crimes, as they have brought immeasurable misfortunes and disasters to the Korean nation. 
					
					 Not a single day has passed in south Korea without plunder, murder, rape and violence since the U.S. forces occupied it. 
					
					 The bestial atrocities committed by the U.S. imperialist aggressor troops against south Korean women, in particular, are unprecedented in the world.
					
					 Their atrocities that make all Koreans shudder include the hair-cutting of a woman in Tongduchon, painting of a woman in Uijongbu, sexual assault against a six-year-old girl, murder of Yun Kum I and the killing of two schoolgirls Sin Hyo Sun and Sim Mi Son. These atrocities committed by murderers and lechers without parallels made even animals blush. 
					
					 Such atrocities are repeating themselves still now. 
					
					 What should not be overlooked is that the south Korean authorities dodged the probe into the truth about those cases and handed the GI criminals to the U.S. forces side without detaining or punishing them. 
					
					 The group of traitors have been so cruel towards fellow countrymen but are conniving at the GI crimes, submissive to the U.S. while keeping mum about its barbarities. This is another act of treachery and mockery of the nation. 
					
					 The south Korean people can never live in peace even a single day under the jack boots of the aggressors as long as the U.S. forces are present in south Korea. 
					
					 The U.S. forces, the root cause of misfortunes and sufferings of the south Korean people, should pull out of south Korea as early as possible.

articles.title: GIs' Sexual Assaults against S. Korean Girls Denounced
articles.content:
GIs' Sexual Assaults against S. Korean Girls Denounced

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Central Committee of Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League Wednesday issued a statement denouncing the U.S. imperialist aggression troops who committed sexual assaults against teenage schoolgirls of south Korea.
					
					 It said:
					
					 Some days ago, a GI in south Korea committed violence against a schoolgirl and not content with it, he tied her to rape. 
					
					 On Sept. 17 another GI raped a schoolgirl in Mapho District, Seoul and ran away with her laptop.
					
					 These are hideous crimes against humanity disclosing once again the brutality of the U.S. imperialists accustomed to immorality and massacre.
					
					 The Central Committee of Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, on behalf of all the youth and students in the DPRK,  bitterly denounces the sexual crimes by the GIs as an intolerable insult to all the south Koreans including youth and students and all other Koreans and as the second Yun Kum I case which shocked the world.
					
					 These cases are neither a matter confined to one or two south Korean schoolgirls nor an accidental crime committed by an individual GI.
					
					 They are an inevitable product of the U.S. forces' true nature as heinous aggressors who regard the south Korean people as colonial slaves whom they can kill and trifle with as they please.
					
					 They are also a result of the sycophancy towards the U.S. on the part of the south Korean puppet group who tries hard to prolong its remaining days by kowtowing to the U.S.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists occupied south Korea by force and inflicted untold misfortune and disasters on the south Korean youth, students and other people, strutting about as beings with extraterritorial rights.
					
					 It is the GIs who shot to death a girl picking edible herbs calling her a "pheasant" and gang raped a young girl by turns before strangling her to death. It is also the brutal GIs who ran an armored car over schoolgirls who were passing by in broad daylight and impudently excused themselves that they were in the middle of their military exercises.
					
					 Much upset by the protest of the angered south Koreans, the U.S. talked about "regret" and "apology". But this is nothing but a deceptive trick to cover up its true colors as an unheard-of manslaughter and chieftain of immorality and calm down the people's grievances.
					
					 As long as south Korea remains the U.S. colony and the humiliating south Korea-U.S. "Status of Forces Agreement" exists, the crimes by the U.S. troops will never cease. 
					
					 The south Korean puppet group of traitors are scheming to hush up the recent case, obedient to the U.S. under the pretext of "alliance."
					
					 The reality clearly proves that young people, girls in particular, can neither bring into bloom their desire for learning nor evade as miserable fate as Sin Hyo Sun and Sim Mi Son as long as the puppet group of sycophantic traitors are allowed to stay in power in south Korea. 
					
					 The south Korean society, where traitors lord it over under the jack boots of the outsiders, calls on the youth and students loving justice and patriotism to the sacred struggle for independence, democracy and reunification.
					
					 All the south Korean youth and students should turn out in the nationwide struggle to drive the U.S. imperialist aggression troops, chieftain of aggression and massacre, out of south Korea at once, put an end to the U.S. military occupation and colonial rule and wipe out despicable sycophantic traitors serving the U.S.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Patriotic Call for Building of New Country
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Patriotic Call for Building of New Country

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- Sixty-six years has passed since a Pyongyang mass rally was held at the then Pyongyang public playground on October 14, Juche 34 (1945) to welcome President Kim Il Sung's triumphant return to the homeland. 
					
					 At that time the newspaper Pyongyang Minbo in an article titled "Cheers of 400,000 People Rocking Tapestry-like Land" said that when General Kim Il Sung, whom the Korean people were deeply revering and eagerly waiting for, appeared on the platform, the ralliers greeted him with enthusiastic cheers, moved to tears. 
					
					 Kim Il Sung delivered a historic speech "Every Effort for the Building of a New, Democratic Korea" at the rally. He said the time came when the Korean people had to pool their efforts to build a new, democratic Korea. 
					
					 He called upon those with strength to give their strength, those with knowledge to contribute their knowledge and those with money to donate their money for the state building. 
					
					 In hearty response to his call, the Korean people made strenuous efforts to provide solid foundations for building a prosperous country. 
					
					His speech has still encouraged the Korean people to turn out in the effort for accelerating socialist construction. 
					
					 The Korean people are now working hard for the prosperity of the country under the Songun (military-first) leadership of Kim Jong Il as they did for the building of a new, prosperous country, independent and sovereign, united closely around Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Mt. Kumgang in Autumn
articles.content:
Mt. Kumgang in Autumn

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- World-famous Mt. Kumgang in the DPRK is characterized by myriad-shaped rocks, crystal-clear water, fantastic waterfalls and thick foliage.
					
					 In autumn, the mountain is a spectacular sight as it is covered with golden leaves.
					
					 Mt. Kumgang changes with seasons and weather conditions, called Mt. Phungak in autumn.
					
					 The celebrated mountain draws a larger number of people in autumn than any other seasons.

articles.title: S. Korea to Stage 2011 Hwarang Exercises
articles.content:
S. Korea to Stage 2011 Hwarang Exercises

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- The puppet Army Metropolitan Garrison Command announced that it would stage 2011 Hwarang Exercises from October 17 to 21, according to south Korean Yonhap News.
					
					 The puppet warmongers are set to involve police forces, administrative organs and even civilians in the military exercises.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Start of "Voice for Unification" Slammed
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Start of "Voice for Unification" Slammed

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the Ministry of Unification of south Korea formally started what it called Internet "Voice for Unification" allegedly aimed at "building up public opinion and spreading information" on unification. The ministry is set to air its programs with main stress on anti-DPRK propaganda materials produced by itself.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says in a by-lined commentary in this regard:
					
					 This is a vicious political provocation against the DPRK as it is designed to block the independent reunification, peace and prosperity based on the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and realize the ambition to achieve "unification of systems" at any cost against the will of the nation.
					
					 The ministry seeks to massively air conspiratorial propaganda programs, far from drawing a lesson from the failure of the "policy toward the north" in a bid to cover up its crimes and justify its moves to escalate the confrontation.
					
					  It is the sinister aim sought by the conservative group in its start of the above-said broadcasting to calm down the ever growing desire to achieve the reunification through an alliance with the north in south Korea and turn it into an atmosphere of confrontation with the DPRK. 
					
					 This is proved by the fact that by airing the above-said radio programs the mandarins of the ministry seek to peddle its proposal for "unifying systems" and show scenes dealing with the life of the human scum who betrayed the nation.
					
					  Confrontation maniacs leave no means untried to do harm to compatriots while persistently sticking to their anachronistic "policy toward the north." It is impossible to remove the distrust and defuse tension between the north and the south nor is it possible to improve the inter-Korean relations as long as these forces are allowed to stay in power in south Korea. 
					
					 The conservative group will certainly have to pay for such reckless anti-reunification acts as blocking the nation's reconciliation and unity and the process for improving the inter-Korean relations and frantically agitating a war.

articles.title: S. Korean Conservative Rulers' Traitorous Policy Assailed
articles.content:
S. Korean Conservative Rulers' Traitorous Policy Assailed 

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- The south Korean conservative ruling quarters cling to the appeasement and deceptive tactic to cover up their unpopular and traitorous crimes while intensifying the suppression of progressive forces. However, it will hasten their destruction. 
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a bylined article. 
					
					 The days of the south Korean ruling quarters have already been numbered and they have no other way to escape from the punishment by the people, it notes, and goes on:
					
					 Their hideous crimes against the people can never be concealed. 
					
					 They mercilessly harmed the dignity and interests of the south Korean people through sycophantic treachery. 
					
					 They persistently seek confrontation between the north and the south, bringing the danger of war to the fellow countrymen. 
					
					 The conservative group turned south Korea to a tundra of democracy and the land with worst human rights record. For this crime only, they deserve punishment by history. 
					
					 They are gravely miscalculated if they think they can cover up their hideous crimes with appeasement, deception and fascist oppression. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities' deception of people and suppression of progressive forces are an open declaration to continue to pursue their traitorous policy. 
					
					 The south Korean rulers had long been forsaken by the people for their crimes. This is one of the important reasons why they cannot realize their ambition to stay in power.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Suppression of Progressive Personages Slammed
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Suppression of Progressive Personages Slammed

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Progress of south Korea issued a statement on Monday in denunciation of the authorities' suppression of progressive figures on the strength of the "National Security Law".
					
					 The statement noted that the Prosecution reclaimed the examination of the arrest warrants for the co-chairman and general secretary of the Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty and other members of the organization.
					
					 In May the Prosecution tried to arrest and put them into custody on charges of violation of the NSL only to be dismissed, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 It is now thinking detaining them again after the lapse of five months.
					
					 This suppression is just aimed to make actual results in line with the call of the chief prosecutor for the "liquidation of the left faction".
					
					 The statement urged the prosecution authorities to immediately stop the moves to detain the members of solidarity, while calling for stopping the fascist suppression of progressive forces and reunification activists.

articles.title: S. Korean IS's Illegal Watch Disclosed
articles.content:
S. Korean IS's Illegal Watch Disclosed

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- The Intelligence Service (IS) of south Korea was disclosed to have kept track of civic and social organizations in secrecy, sparking furor, according to "Voice of People", an Internet broadcasting of south Korea on October 10.
					
					 This was disclosed through the "notice of execution of measures for restricting communications" worked out by IS.
					
					 According to it, the Pusan branch under IS tapped telephones of the core members of the Pusan Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration till October last year from 2007 and recorded all the contents down to the dialogues about their private life.
					
					 It has regularly watched fax, e-mail and Internet lines of the organization.
					
					 The organization attended joint national events in the north and received a congratulatory message. Charging it as the violation of the "National Security Law", the IS illegally bugged the members of the organization.
					
					 Communication means of the Pusan Action Headquarters of the Movement for Reunified Korean Nation and the Women's Council for Reunification were also under watch.
					
					 The executive chairman and secretary general of the Pusan Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration said it is very shocking that the IS has long kept eyes on them in secrecy.
					
					 The members of the Pusan Action Headquarters of the Movement for Reunified Korean Nation, angered at IS, said no one knows who is under IS's watch now.
					
					 They urged IS to bear responsibility for the recent case.

articles.title: Anniversary of October 4 Declaration Marked in China
articles.content:
Anniversary of October 4 Declaration Marked in China 

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- The Yanbian regional federation of the General Association of Koreans in China and its affiliated branches and the Yanbian regional youth committee of the Youth Federation of Koreans in China held a commemoration meeting in Yanji City, Jilin Province of China on Oct. 4 on the fourth anniversary of the October 4 declaration. 
					
					 Speakers said that under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il the historic north-south summit was held and the October 4 declaration was adopted. It was events to be specially recorded in the history of advancing the movement for national reunification to a new phase under the banner of the June 15 joint declaration, they noted, and went on:
					
					 The adoption of the October 4 declaration helped the Korean nation make a big progress in the struggle for national reunification and prosperity. 
					
					 However, no sooner had it come to power than the present regime of south Korea totally denied the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and drove the inter-Korean relations to a catastrophe by pursuing confrontation policy.
					
					 The reality clearly proves that it is impossible to achieve peace and national reunification on the Korean Peninsula as long as the south Korean authorities are allowed to stay in power.
					
					 They called upon all the Koreans in China to turn out in the struggle to shatter the reckless anti-DPRK moves of war and confrontation on the part of the anti-reunification forces and open up a new phase for independent reunification by pooling efforts of the Korean nation. 
					
					 A letter to leader Kim Jong Il was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: Chinese Premier Calls for Supply System of Fresh Farm Produce
articles.content:
Chinese Premier Calls for Supply System of Fresh Farm Produce

					 Beijing, October 11 (KCNA) -- Chinese Premier Wen Jiabao called for setting up a supply system of fresh farm produce at a State Council meeting held on Saturday.
					
					 Adopted at the meeting were a draft law on immigration management and a draft decision on issues of strengthening the anti-terrorism combat.
					
					 The meeting decided to commit the drafts to the deliberation by the Standing Committee of the Chinese National People's Congress.

articles.title: Larijani: Regional Countries Should Boost Cooperation
articles.content:
Larijani: Regional Countries Should Boost Cooperation

					 Tehran, October 11 (KCNA) -- Iran's Majlis Speaker Ali Larijani in a diplomatic appearance on Sunday called for boosting cooperation among regional countries.
					
					 The presence of foreign forces in the region is the root cause of all complicated problems such as terrorism and drug trafficking, he said.
					
					 To comprehensively expand and strengthen multilateral cooperative relations among regional countries is the only way of settling these problems and ensuring the regional peace and security, he noted.

articles.title: Dominican President Supports Palestine's Statehood
articles.content:
Dominican President Supports Palestine's Statehood

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- Dominican President Leonel Antonio Fernandez Reyna in a diplomatic appearance on Friday formally offered his country's support for Palestine's bid to gain recognition as a sovereign state.
					
					 Palestine has the same legitimate right as other countries to join the United Nations, he noted.
					
					 Recognizing the statehood of Palestine would help bring about lasting peace in the Middle East, he said.

articles.title: PLO Condemns Israeli Maltreatment of Prisoners
articles.content:
PLO Condemns Israeli Maltreatment of Prisoners

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- Yasser Abed Rabbo, secretary general of the Executive Committee of the Palestine Liberation Organization (PLO), in a statement on October 9 condemned Israel for maltreating Palestinian prisoners in Israeli jails.
					
					 The Israeli authorities are harshly treating Palestinian prisoners in their hunger strike in demand of their legitimate rights, he said.
					
					 Terming it a wanton violation of international law, he called upon the international community to press the Israeli authorities to ensure the prisoners the elementary right and set them free at an early date.

articles.title: Israeli Army Arrests 6 Palestinians in West Bank
articles.content:
Israeli Army Arrests 6 Palestinians in West Bank

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- The Israeli army arrested six innocent Palestinians early Sunday in different cities of the West Bank. 
					
					 The Israeli army keeps arresting Palestinians despite the protest and denunciation of the international community.

articles.title: More NATO Soldiers Killed in Afghanistan
articles.content:
More NATO Soldiers Killed in Afghanistan

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- More NATO soldiers in Afghanistan met deaths due to the attack of the resistance forces of the country.
					
					 Two NATO soldiers were killed on Saturday in an insurgent attack in restive southern Afghanistan's region.
					
					 Over 470 NATO soldiers, most of them Americans, have been killed in Afghanistan since beginning this year.

articles.title: Cooperation of Different Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation of Different Countries

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- Cuba and Peru on October 6 agreed to boost bilateral cooperative relations in various fields. The agreement was signed during the Peruvian vice-president's visit to Cuba.
					
					 Slovakia and Serbia signed an agreement on mutual cooperation in preventing disasters on Oct. 4.

articles.title: Anti-U.S. Rally Held in Afghanistan
articles.content:
Anti-U.S. Rally Held in Afghanistan

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- A rally was held in Kabul, Afghanistan on Thursday, the eve of the 10-year anniversary of the U.S. start of the Afghan war. Hundreds of Afghans condemned the U.S. forces as occupiers while burning a U.S. flag.
					
					 They accused the United States of massacring Afghan civilians under the pretext of "anti-terrorism". They strongly demanded the immediate withdrawal of all foreign troops including the U.S. forces.

articles.title: Business Management Gets Serious in Capitalist Countries
articles.content:
Business Management Gets Serious in Capitalist Countries

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- Department store chain Takashimaya Co. of Japan said Friday its group net profit in the March-August first half of 2011 business year plunged 35.7 percent from a year earlier.
					
					 The German government said on Oct. 6 that its industry orders fell 1.4 percent based on seasonally-adjusted terms in August, compared with the same month of last year. It is said that industrial businesses were in the grip of depression due to decrease of orders.
					
					 French car sales dropped 1.4 percent in September over the same period last year.

articles.title: Severe Punishment of GIs Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Severe Punishment of GIs Demanded in S. Korea 

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty in a statement on Oct. 8 demanded the severe punishment of GIs who made sexual attacks on teen-age schoolgirls in south Korea.
					
					 It said the recent sexual assaults against schoolgirls in Tongduchon of Kyonggi Province and Seoul are triggering a wrath from the people.
					
					 The statement branded the crimes as intentional ones.
					
					 It also called for imposing heavy penalty on the criminals.
					
					 As long as the south Korea-U.S. "Status of Forces Agreement" exists, such crimes will never cease, the statement noted.
					
					 It urged the U.S. president to make an immediate apology to the south Korean people for the present situation in which the GIs trifle with south Korean women and commit whole gamut of crimes.

articles.title: Bus Trade Unionists in S. Korea Launch Strike
articles.content:
Bus Trade Unionists in S. Korea Launch Strike 

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- Unionists of the Samhwa Highway Trade Unions of the Bus Action Headquarters under the Confederation of Trade Unions launched an indefinite strike from October 10 in demand of wage hike, according to the south Korean MBC.
					
					 They denounced the business side for not accepting the demand of the trade unions, although they held 9 negotiations on wage increase.

articles.title: Natural Disasters in Different Countries
articles.content:
Natural Disasters in Different Countries

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- Damage caused by forest fire is expanding in the Siberian Region, Russia.
					
					 The acres damaged by forest fire increased to 2 368 hectares in Zabaikal Territory, the Republic of Buryatia and the Republic of Tiba as of October 9, the Ministry of Extraordinary Situation said.
					
					 Flood death toll increases in Thailand.
					
					 A total of 252 people were confirmed dead and a total number of the victims were about 2.7 million as of October 7.
					
					 Flood damage caused by heavy rains is increasing in Cambodia.
					
					 At least 206 people have been killed and more than 230 000 families have been affected as of October 8.
					
					 At least two people died in Colombia on Friday and another four were missing after a landslide crushed a number of houses in the southern province of Valle de Cauca. Roads were blocked, paralyzing traffic.

articles.title: Pakistani Religious Leader Accuses U.S.
articles.content:
Pakistani Religious Leader Accuses U.S.

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- The Pakistani religious leader in an interview with a news agency on October 7 scathingly accused the United States.
					
					 He said that the U.S. is playing a double game, on one hand they are concerned about human rights violation in the world but on the other hand they are supporting the Israeli aggression on innocent Palestinian people.
					
					 The U.S. has no right to interfere with the matters of other countries, he noted.
					
					 He said that the U.S. has been losing its grip and almost standing on the verge of collapse.

articles.title: Belarusian President Rejects West's Unreasonable Demand
articles.content:
Belarusian President Rejects West's Unreasonable Demand

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko in a press conference on October 7 rejected the West's unreasonable demand on his country.
					
					 "The West is constantly laying down certain conditions to us -- political prisoners, privatization," he said. He denied the West-touted political prisoners and any serious economic crisis in his country.
					
					 Belarus will settle its problems by itself, he stressed, demanding the West not interfere in its internal affairs so that the Belarusian people should live peacefully.

articles.title: Random Use of Foreign Languages in South Korea Deplored
articles.content:
Random Use of Foreign Languages in South Korea Deplored

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- A representative of the south Korean Language Association Saturday deplored the random use of foreign languages in south Korea in a press interview.
					
					 He said street signboards, company names and even the titles of the official institutions are called in foreign languages. 
					
					 The people with the world's best language refuse to use their own language, he said, adding:
					
					 It has become social trend in south Korea to use the combination of Chinese and English and speak in a foreign way.
					
					 The authorities have failed to take measures to stop the usage of foreign languages while touting "globalization".
					
					 The Korean alphabets are admitted to be the best by the world.

articles.title: West's Hope for Resumption of Six-party Talks Is Hypocritical
articles.content:
West's Hope for Resumption of Six-party Talks Is Hypocritical

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- Russia's Internet news Inforos analyzed the West's attitude towards the six-party talks, saying:
					
					 A main agenda item of the Russia-DPRK summit meeting in Ulan-Ude in August was to coordinate the nuclear issue on the Korean peninsula. The latter voiced its willingness to return to the six-party talks and make effort for an early resumption of the talks without precondition.  
					
					 But some parties to the talks took an unexpected reaction to the meeting, stirring up a different view. 
					
					 The United States and south Korea remain unchanged in their attitude toward the prospect of the resumption of the six-party talks. They persist in their worn-out demand concerning the implementation of preconditions.   For example, south Korean diplomats called for the implementation of preconditions again at the talks held with the north side in Beijing some time ago. It is self-evident that such contacts cannot be helpful to the resumption of the talks. 
					
					 The West's claim that it hopes for an early reopening of the six-party talks is just an empty talk. In actuality, the West apparently seeks overturning the DPRK. 
					
					 This year Russia has affirmed that it does not support the policy of isolating the DPRK.

articles.title: West Interrupts Russia-DPRK Friendship: Internet News
articles.content:
West Interrupts Russia-DPRK Friendship: Internet News 

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- Russia's internet news Inforos denounced the West for interrupting Russia-DPRK friendship.
					
					 The fresh development of the friendly relationship between Moscow and Pyongyang has become pronounced this year, steadily drawing attention of world mass media along with some unexpected interpretations, Inforos said, adding:
					
					 Main issues discussed at the Russia-DPRK summit talks in Ulan-Ude in August were to coordinate the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula and lay a gas pipeline through DPRK from Russia.
					
					 Strange to say, some people of Japan and south Korea expressed their dissatisfaction and misgivings at the gas pipeline plan agreed at the Ulan-Ude talks. The plan containing a multipartite economic cooperation idea has been treated by them as a problem complicating the prospect of the regional cooperation.
					
					 This year Russia has affirmed that it does not support the policy of isolating DPRK but opposes extended interpretation and application of sanctions sponsored by the UN Security Council. It also considers that such sanctions should not affect civilian economic sectors of the country.
					
					 Moscow, out of its desire to be integrated into the East Asia cooperation process, has turned its face to its traditional partner.
					
					 This makes the West's intention to inveigle Russia and China into the anti-DPRK alliance illogical.

articles.title: Gingko Leaf Extract Good for Diseases
articles.content:
Gingko Leaf Extract Good for Diseases

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- Various kinds of Koryo medicines made with gingko leaf extract are used to treat diseases.
					
					 The extract is very efficacious for cardiac and cerebral diseases.
					
					From olden times gingko tree has also been called Tusimmok meaning that it is good for brain and heart.
					
					 Researchers of the Koryo Medicine Research Institute affiliated to the Academy of Koryo Medicine have newly found out medical properties and pharmacological action of gingko leaf.
					
					 They have also established a new manufacturing process of gingko leaf extract.
					
					 Gingko leaf injections for heart and arteriosclerosis enjoy popularity in domestic and foreign markets.

articles.title: U.S. Apology for Sexual Assaults Urged
articles.content:
U.S. Apology for Sexual Assaults Urged

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- Women's organizations including the Women's Solidarity of south Korea held a press conference on Monday in the vicinity of the U.S. embassy in Seoul urging the U.S. to make apology for GIs' sexual assaults against girl students.
					
					 A press release was read out at the conference.
					
					 The release said that GIs' brutal sexual assaults against schoolgirls in Tongduchon of Kyonggi Province and Seoul sparked furor.
					
					 The incidents brought to light the inequality of the south Korea-U.S. "Status of Forces Agreement" (SOFA), it noted, and went on:
					
					 The police has no right to arrest and investigate GIs' evident crimes and the Prosecution has no right of intermediate appeal although the criminal is put on a trial. On the contrary, the SOFA grants the U.S. side only the right to bring appeal in a court. This is the essence of the agreement.
					
					 It is due to the shackling SOFA that the GIs' crimes are on the steady increase and victims are suffering pains.
					
					 The release urged the U.S. to immediately make apology for the sexual assaults, take measures to prevent the recurrence of similar incidents and revise the SOFA.
					
					 If the U.S. fails to accept the demand of the people, it would meet the same nation-wide candle-light resistance as in 2002 after the killing of two girl students, the release warned.
					
					 The participants in the conference staged demonstration holding slogan boards reading "U.S. president, apologize for sexual assaults by GIs in south Korea", "U.S., take measures to end GIs' crimes against women" and "Revise unequal SOFA at once".

articles.title: DPRK's Proposal for Founding DFRK Supported by Nigerian Organization
articles.content:
DPRK's Proposal for Founding DFRK Supported by Nigerian Organization

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea on October 3 posted on its Internet homepage an article entitled "For the Reunification of the Country" on the 31st anniversary of the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo and the 10th anniversary of the Three Charters for National Reunification Memorial Tower.
					
					 Many Koreans in the north and the south and abroad and foreigners visited the tower in the past period, the article said, and went on:
					
					 The tower reflects the ardent desire of all Koreans in the north and the south to reunify the country by the concerted efforts of the nation.
					
					 The south Korean authorities are opposed to the proposal for founding the DFRK, an important part of the Three Charters for National Reunification.
					
					 To force one side's ideology and system upon the other side in the Korean Peninsula where differing ideologies and systems have existed in the north and the south for more than half a century since the division is little short of one side swallowing up the other side.
					
					 This is precisely a "unification" formula sought by the south Korean authorities.
					
					 The present south Korean ruling forces are the arch criminals who overturned the north-south agreement on achieving reunification by federal formula and pushed the inter-Korean relations to those of confrontation. 
					
					 In order to achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea at an early date, the south Korean authorities should accept the proposal for achieving reunification by federal formula.

articles.title: Anniversary of October 4 Declaration Marked by Cambodian Radios
articles.content:
Anniversary of October 4 Declaration Marked by Cambodian Radios

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- Cambodian radios aired commemorative programs on the fourth anniversary of the October 4 declaration.
					
					 FM 90.5 Radio said on October 3 that the October 4 declaration is a programme for comprehensively implementing the June 15 joint declaration which was adopted in 2000.
					
					 The declaration clarified the will of the north and the south of Korea to defend and positively implement the June 15 joint declaration, it noted, and went on:
					
					 The October 4 declaration reaffirmed the idea of "By our nation itself", the basic spirit of the June 15 joint declaration.
					
					 The declaration stressed the need to settle the reunification question independently in the idea of "By our nation itself" and orient everything to protecting the dignity and interests of the nation, etc.
					
					 It advanced a reasonable way of implementing the June 15 joint declaration.
					
					 It widely reflected all the issues of achieving the relations between the north and the south and the peace of the Korean Peninsula, prosperity common to the nation and reunification.
					
					 It is the unanimous aspiration and will of all the Koreans for ushering in a new era of national prosperity and independent reunification to pool will and efforts and thoroughly defend and implement the October 4 declaration in the idea of "By our nation itself" indicated by the June 15 joint declaration. 
					
					 Apsara TV and Radio aired the same program on October 4.

articles.title: Taean Heavy Machine Complex Honors Its Annual Plan
articles.content:
Taean Heavy Machine Complex Honors Its Annual Plan

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- The Taean Heavy Machine Complex honored its plan for 2011 at 103.5 % till Sunday.
					
					 Officials, workers and technicians of the complex carried out its January assignment in a matter of little over 10 days at 101.5 % and surpassed the level of peak production year in February.
					
					 The processing of turbine blades rose 1.2 times and the production of turbine shafts and generator shafts and other major components three times as compared with those last year.  
					
					 They also increased the assembling speed of generating equipment such as generator poles, shafts and rotator frame 1.5 times.
					
					 Extra-large machine tools have been put on a CNC basis, processing turbine and generator blades in a matter of a few days which would have taken a month before.
					
					 The quality of insulating material has significantly improved.
					
					 The complex finished the production of generating equipment for the Huichon Power Station by the end of August.
					
					 The workers and technicians of the complex are making uninterrupted innovations and advance, proud of having honored this year's assignment on the occasion of the founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: WPK's Important Days Marked in Different Countries
articles.content:
WPK's Important Days Marked in Different Countries
						

					 Pyongyang, October12 (KCNA) -- Celebrations took place in different countries on the 66th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea and the 85th anniversary of the Down-with-Imperialism Union. They included meetings, book and photo exhibitions, film shows and art performances in Myanmar, Dominica, Sweden and Thailand on Sept. 30 and Oct. 5.
					
					 Displayed in the venues of the events were works of President Kim Il Sung and general secretary Kim Jong Il, photos on their leadership feats for party building and pictures introducing the real picture of the DPRK.
					
					 Films shown included "The Tower of the Juche Idea" and "Four Seasons in Pyongyang."
					
					 The deputy chief of the Yangon Regional Committee of the Solidarity and Development Party of the Union of Myanmar said that the WPK founded by Kim Il Sung is leading to victory the Korean people in their struggle to achieve country's prosperity under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Ivan Rodriguez, general secretary of the Revolutionary Alternative Party of Dominica, noted that the DPRK is fully exercising its sovereignty in the international arena and working miracles in the building of an economic power under the wise guidance of the WPK headed by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Songchit Pullarp, chairman of the Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea of Thailand, said the foundation of the WPK made it possible for the Korean people to hold the President in high esteem as the centre of unity and leadership and build a socialist power, independent in politics, self-supporting in national economy and self-reliant in defence.
					
					 Messages of greetings to Kim Jong Il were adopted at the events held in Thailand.

articles.title: WPK Praised by Foreign Media
articles.content:
WPK Praised by Foreign Media

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- Bangladeshi and Indian papers carried special write-ups on Oct. 5 and 6 on the 66th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea and the 85th anniversary of the Down-with-Imperialism Union.
					
					 The Bangladeshi newspaper Blits carried an article with a photo of President Kim Il Sung and pictures of the Tower of the Juche Idea and the Chollima Statue.
					
					 The paper in an article titled "Founding of the Juche Idea" said that the President embarked upon the road of revolution in his early years and founded the Juche idea, a great idea guiding the era of independence.
					
					 In an article titled "One for All and All for One!" the paper recalled that the President visited the Kangson Steel Works in December 1956 to meet its workers and kindle the torch of a collective innovation movement.
					
					 The Indian newspapers Science Technology and Education News and India Europe News and Information Bureau noted that the WPK has grown to be an invincible party enjoying absolute support and trust from the people.

articles.title: Work Off Press in Venezuela
articles.content:
Work Off Press in Venezuela

					 Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- General secretary Kim Jong Il's work "The Workers' Party of Korea Is the Party of the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung" was brought out in pamphlet by the Canta Clara Publishing House of Venezuela on Oct. 5.
					
					 The work, published on October 2, Juche 84 (1995) proudly reviews the glorious history of the WPK in which it paved a new way for building a revolutionary party in the era of independence under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung and indicates the way for developing the WPK into an eternal party of the President.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea posted the full text of the work on its Internet homepage on Oct. 2.

articles.title: Seminario dedicad al Dia Mundial de Lavado de Manos
articles.content:
Seminario dedicad al Dia Mundial de Lavado de Manos

					 Pyongyang, 12 de octubre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 12 en el capitalino Palacio de Estudio del Pueblo el seminario dedicado al Dia Mundial de Lavado de Manos 2011 (15 de octubre),.
					
					 Estuvieron presentes los funcionarios del Comite de Educacion, el Ministerio de Urbanismo y otras unidades correspondientes y los miembros de la Representacion del Fondo de las Naciones Unidas para la Infancia (UNICEF en ingles) acreditada en Corea.
					
					 En la ocasion hicieron uso de la palabra el director de departamento del Ministerio de Urbanismo Song Yong Su (50 anos de edad) y el representante de UNICEF en Corea, Bijaya Rajbhandari (55 anos de edad).
					
					 Se impartieron las lecciones intituladas "Dia Mundial de Lavado de Manos y actividades de lavar manos en varios regiones del mundo" y "Sobre el estado de educacion higienica por lavar manos en la rama de ensenanza general de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y su perspectiva" y hubo intervenciones de experiencias de maestros y alumnos de las escuelas.
					
					 El Dia Mundial de Lavado de Manos se celebra desde 2008 fijado como Ano Internacional de Higiene.
					
					 Su objetivo esta en elevar la conciencia de las personas, en particular, de los ninos y jovenes, sobre la ventaja de observar bien la higiene privada como lavar las manos con jabon y en acostumbrarlo en la vida cotidiana.

articles.title: Entidad juvenil de la RPDC condena violacion sexual en Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Entidad juvenil de la RPDC condena violacion sexual en Sur de Corea

					 Pyongyang, 12 de octubre (ACNC) -- El portavoz del Comite Central de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung hizo publica el dia 12 una declaracion de condena a los agresores yanquis que violaron sexualmente a las alumnas surcoreanas de diez y tantos anos de edad.
					
					 El texto del documento va como sigue:
					
					 Hace poco, un uniformado norteamericano ocupante del Sur de Corea dio en Tongduchon de la provincia de Kyonggi la violacion sexual a una alumna surcoreana tras atarle todo el cuerpo.
					
					 El 17 de septiembre tambien otro militar gringo violo sexualmente a una alumna en Maphogu de Seul y le robo hasta la computadora.
					
					 Esto es otro crimen antietico que volvio a mostrar la bestial naturaleza de los agresores gringos acostumbrados a la inmoralidad y la matanza de seres humanos.
					
					 El Comite Central de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung lo califica de insulto intolerable a todos los jovenes, estudiantes y habitantes surcoreanos y a la nacion coreana y de un segundo incidente de Yun Kum I, que habia causado la indignacion de todo el mundo, y lo denuncia severamente con vehemente indignacion de todos los jovenes y estudiantes de la RPDC.
					
					 Tales incidentes no son un problema relacionado con unas alumnas surcoreanas, ni crimenes casuales de algunos uniformados norteamericanos.
					
					 Es un resultado inevitable proveniente de la naturaleza bandidesca de las tropas agresoras norteamericanas que consideran a los pobladores surcoreanos como esclavos coloniales y de las acciones humillantes de la banda titere que hace todo lo posible para salvar su vida obedeciendo a EE.UU.
					
					 Los agresores yanquis ocuparon militarmente el Sur de Corea y acarrearon incontables desgracias y desastres a los jovenes, estudiantes y otros habitantes surcoreanos actuando como ente extraterritorial.  
					
					 Mataron a tiros a una nina que recogia hierbas comestibles en el monte calificandola de "faisan" y asesinaron apretando garganta a una chica tras violarla por turno. Ademas, atropellaron en el pleno dia con el carro blindado a las dos ninas que caminaban.
					
					  A pesar de eso, ellos dijeron descaradamente que es un incidente ocurrido durante el entrenamiento.
					
					  Atemorizado ante las protestas de los habitantes surcoreanos, Estados Unidos habla de "disculpa" y "lastima", pero, esto no pasa de ser una intriga enganosa para ocultar su sucia naturaleza del asesino y cabecilla de depravaciones e inmoralidades y calmar la indignacion de los surcoreanos.
					
					  Mientras el Sur de Corea esta bajo el coloniaje de EE.UU. y existe el humillante "acuerdo de administracion" Sur de Corea-EE.UU., surgiran sucesivamente los crimenes de las tropas norteamericanos.
					
					  Sin embargo, la banda traidora titere intenta tratar ambiguamente tales presentes incidentes so pretexto de "relaciones de alianza".
					
					  La realidad muestra fehacientemente que si dejan intacta a la banda conservadora titere, grupo de vendepatrias proyanquis, los jovenes, estudiantes y otras muchachas, que suenan con el futuro radiante, no podran evitar el destino tragico como el de Sin Hyo Sun y Sim Mi Son.
					
					  La sociedad surcoreana, pisoteada por las fuerzas extranjeras y gobernada por los traidores, llama a los jovenes y estudiantes con la justicia y el patriotismo a la sagrada lucha por la independencia, la democracia y la reunificacion.
					
					  Todos los jovenes y estudiantes surcoreanos deben retirar de inmediato del Sur de Corea a las tropas norteamericanas, cabecilla de agresion y asesinato, poner fin a la agresion militar y dominacion colonial de EE.UU. y eliminar a los traidores proyanquis.

articles.title: Monte Kumgang en otono
articles.content:
Monte Kumgang en otono

					 Pyongyang, 12 de octubre (ACNC) -- En estos dias otonales, se pone mas maravilloso el monte Kumgang de Corea, conocido ampliamente en el mundo por sus rocas curiosas de mil formas, aguas cristalinas, cascadas y vegetacion frondosa.
					
					 El nombre del monte variaba segun las estaciones del ano y en otono se llamaba como el "Phung-ak".
					
					 El monte Kumgang acoge a mayor numero de visitantes en otono porque se torna mas espectacular que cualquier otra estacion.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun denuncia provocacion politica de Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun denuncia provocacion politica de Sur de Corea 

					 Pyongyang, 12 de octubre (ACNC) -- Recientemente, el Ministerio de Reunificacion del Sur de Corea puso en funcionamiento oficial la "Radiodifusion de reunificacion" de internet so pretexto de la "creacion de la opinion publica e informacion" sobre la reunificacion, a traves de lo cual planea emitir las multimedias redactadas por si mismo para calumniar a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					 Esto es una siniestra provocacion politica anti-RPDC tendente a estorbar a toda costa la reunificacion independiente, la paz y la prosperidad basadas en la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio y la Declaracion del 4 de Octubre y a realizar una ambicion de "unificacion de regimenes" anti- nacional.
					
					 Senala asi el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual divulgado este miercoles y  continua:
					
					 En vez de sacar leccion de su fallada "politica sobre el Norte", el Ministerio de Reunificacion del Sur de Corea trata de emitir en gran cantidad multimedias intrigantes para  encubrir  sus crimenes y justificar las maniobras conflictivas.
					
					 El objetivo principal de tal acto es reprimir el cada dia mas creciente clima de reunificacion pro-Norte y cambiarlo en otro de confrontacion anti-RPDC. Lo prueba el hecho de que los compinches del Ministerio de Reunificacion tratan de emitir el proyecto de "unificacion de regimenes" y el aspecto de vida de escorias humanas, traidores a la nacion.
					
					 Mientras los maniacos conflictivos del Sur de Corea siguen tomando el poder,  nunca podran ser eliminadas la desconfianza y la tension entre las dos partes coreanas ni la mejora de las relaciones bilaterales.
					
					   Pagaran cuenta sin falta las acciones anti-reunificacion de la banda conservadora enloquecida en la agitacion conflictiva dando espaldas a la reconciliacion,  la unidad de la nacion y la mejora de las relaciones intercoreanas.
